com.oceanoptics.omnidriver.features.highgainmode

Interface HighGainMode


  • public interface HighGainMode
    This interface provides functions that give the ability to set a compatible device into High Gain Mode.

    The intended devices are the NIR-256 and NIR-512.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean getHighGainDefault()
      Obtains the High Gain Mode default from the spectrometer.
      boolean hasHighGainDefault()
      Denotes whether or not the device has the ability to set a default state for High Gain Mode.
      void setHighGain(boolean gain)
      Sets the device either into or out of high gain mode.
      void setHighGainDefault(boolean gain)
      Sets the default state for High Gain Mode.

    • Method Detail

      • setHighGain

        void setHighGain(boolean gain)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Sets the device either into or out of high gain mode.
        Parameters:
        gain - boolean denoting whether to put the device into high gain mode; true will put the device into high gain mode, false will take the device out of high gain mode.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs while communicating with the spectrometer.

      • setHighGainDefault

        void setHighGainDefault(boolean gain)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Sets the default state for High Gain Mode.
        Parameters:
        gain - new default state for High Gain Mode; true will put the device in High Gain Mode by default; false will not put the device in High Gain Mode.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs while communicating with the spectrometer.

      • getHighGainDefault

        boolean getHighGainDefault()
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Obtains the High Gain Mode default from the spectrometer.
        Returns:
        true if the default is on; false if the default is off
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs while communicatng with the spectrometer

      • hasHighGainDefault

        boolean hasHighGainDefault()
        Denotes whether or not the device has the ability to set a default state for High Gain Mode.
        Returns:
        true if the device can set a default high gain mode state, false otherwise.
